entity1.name: Virtual Reality (VR)
entity1.description: A computer-generated simulation of a three-dimensional image or environment that can be interacted with in a seemingly real or physical way by a person using special electronic equipment, such as a helmet with a screen inside or gloves fitted with sensors.;;;A technology that simulates a realistic 3D environment, allowing users to interact with it in a seemingly real or physical way.;;;Immersive digital environments that simulate physical presence in a real or imagined world, often used for educational purposes.;;;Head-mounted displays used for virtual reality experiences, providing immersive visual and auditory environments.;;;Virtual Reality technology that provides immersive and interactive digital environments for users to engage with.;;;An advanced form of computer-generated simulation where a replica of an environment is created and experienced through sensory experiences, typically involving sight and sound.;;;Virtual Reality headsets, devices used to provide immersive visual and auditory experiences.;;;Devices that simulate a three-dimensional environment, allowing users to interact with it in a seemingly real or physical way.;;;A computer-generated environment that allows a user to interact with a simulated world, often used for immersive experiences.;;;Virtual Reality technology, a computer-generated environment that allows users to interact with a simulated world.;;;Virtual Reality hardware used for immersive experiences.;;;Simulated experiences that allow users to explore and interact with environments as if they were present in them, providing a sense of immersion.;;;Virtual Reality, a technology that simulates real-world environments and scenarios for immersive experiences.
entity1.chunkid: Virtual Reality in Education14;;;Virtual Reality in Education5;;;Virtual Reality in Education13;;;Virtual Reality in Education9;;;Virtual Reality in Education22;;;Virtual Reality in Education3;;;Virtual Reality in Education4;;;Virtual Reality in Education23;;;Virtual Reality in Education11;;;Virtual Reality in Education16;;;Virtual Reality in Education21;;;Virtual Reality in Education15;;;Virtual Reality in Education1;;;Virtual Reality in Education2;;;Virtual Reality in Education17;;;Virtual Reality in Education10;;;Virtual Reality in Education8

entity2.name: Education
entity2.description: The process of facilitating learning, or the acquisition of knowledge, skills, values, beliefs, and habits. Educational methods include teaching, training, storytelling, discussion, and directed research.;;;The process of facilitating learning and the acquisition of knowledge, skills, values, beliefs, and habits.;;;Institutions dedicated to teaching and learning, including schools of various levels and types.;;;The process of receiving or giving systematic instruction, especially at a school or university.;;;Places or contexts where learning and teaching activities take place, including schools, universities, and other educational institutions.
entity2.chunkid: Virtual Reality in Education10;;;Virtual Reality in Education22;;;Virtual Reality in Education3;;;Virtual Reality in Education15;;;Virtual Reality in Education1;;;Virtual Reality in Education2;;;Virtual Reality in Education13

entity8.name: medical students
entity8.description: A group of individuals studying medicine.

entity9.name: surgical procedures
entity9.description: Operations or treatments performed by medical professionals to treat diseases, injuries, or deformities.

entity10.name: virtual operating room
entity10.description: A simulated environment used for training and practicing surgical procedures without real-world risks.

entity11.name: history students
entity11.description: A group of individuals studying history.

entity12.name: historical landmarks and events
entity12.description: Places or occurrences of significant historical importance that are often studied or visited for educational purposes.

entity14.name: Visual learners
entity14.description: A group of individuals who learn best through visual aids and information presented in a graphical format.

entity15.name: Kinesthetic learners
entity15.description: A group of individuals who learn best through physical activity, hands-on experiences, or movement.

entity17.name: students with disabilities or learning difficulties
entity17.description: A group of individuals who have physical or cognitive impairments that affect their ability to learn in traditional educational settings.

entity22.name: students
entity22.description: A collective term for individuals enrolled in educational institutions or programs.;;;A collective term for individuals who are enrolled in educational institutions or learning programs.
entity22.chunkid: Virtual Reality in Education11;;;Virtual Reality in Education17

entity25.name: classrooms
entity25.description: A room in which classes are held, typically at a school or university.

entity27.name: software
entity27.description: Computer programs or applications that run on VR equipment to provide functionality and content.

entity31.name: young children and adolescents
entity31.description: A segment of the population consisting of individuals who are below the age of adulthood, typically ranging from infancy through teenage years.

entity32.name: motion sickness
entity32.description: A common condition that occurs when the brain receives conflicting messages from the inner ear, eyes, and other parts of the body.

entity33.name: eye strain
entity33.description: Discomfort or fatigue in the eyes usually caused by intense use of the eyes over an extended period of time.

entity34.name: disorientation
entity34.description: A state where a person is confused about their location, time, or identity, often due to sensory overload or other factors.

entity37.name: Professional development programs
entity37.description: Initiatives designed to help educators enhance their skills and knowledge.

entity38.name: teachers
entity38.description: Educators who instruct students in various subjects and grade levels.;;;Professionals who are involved in the teaching and education of students.
entity38.chunkid: Virtual Reality in Education21;;;Virtual Reality in Education23

entity44.name: student learning outcomes
entity44.description: The results or achievements that students are expected to gain from an educational activity or program.
